509: Company Description Founded in 2012, MindMaze is a global leader in brain technology and digital neurotherapeutics solutions for brain health and recovery. Its mission is to accelerate the brain’s ability to recover, learn and adapt. The company has two core divisions – Healthcare and Labs – working collaboratively at the intersection of neuroscience, bio-sensing, engineering, mixed reality, and artificial intelligence. MindMaze Healthcare is advancing a universal platform for brain health with breakthrough solutions to some of the world’s most challenging problems in neurology, including stroke, Parkinson’s disease, and Alzheimer’s disease. MindMaze Labs, the company’s R&D innovation hub, is focused on the future of human computing – working across multiple industries to innovate and build the next generation of human-machine interfaces. The company has offices in Switzerland, the US, France, and India. For more information, please visit www.mindmaze.com. Job Description This is a new role, you will be responsible for driving and overseeing the day-to-day operations of clinical trials and studies (investigator-initiated trials and company-sponsored trials). Your responsibilities: Oversee the smooth running of clinical trials as per protocol, in accordance with regulatory and ethical standards. Support the process of the protocol definition with internal and external stakeholders Write, amend, and submit clinical trial documentation to partners and ethical committees and accompanying patient information material Collect, and organizing documents and data obtained from research according to best practices for data privacy and regulatory compliance (as per FDA / MDR guidelines) Select, establish and manage the relationship with contract research organizations (CROs) Train the study team on study protocol and on proper usage of company medical products Liaise between study team and clinical and product development teams to provide technical support and continuous feedback Contribute to the management of assigned budget Qualifications Bachelor's degree in biomedical, nursing or a related field Training/experience in neuroscience/neuro-engineering/neurorehabilitation is a plus Proven experience (5+ years) in clinical project execution, preferably in (neuro)rehabilitation and medical device industry ; experience with Software as Medical devices (SaMD) and training in project management is a plus In-depth knowledge of ICH-GCP, the Medical Device Directive: understanding of US and European medical device clinical trial approval procedures Experience in developing and managing clinical trial budgets, as well as in working with external contract research organizations Superior analytical and organizational skills: attention to detail and accuracy Very good written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills Fluent level of English Additional Information Please note that the job title listed in this posting is not set in stone and may be adapted to better reflect the skills and experience of the ideal candidate.
